Sure, here is an example of a letter you might write to your doctor discussing the symptoms and concerns you've shared with me:

Subject: Follow-up on Health Concerns

Dear [Doctor's Name],

I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to follow up on our recent appointment, during which we discussed my health concerns related to HPPD, dissociation, and brain fog.

As a reminder, I have been experiencing symptoms of HPPD for several years, which include visual distortions and hallucinations similar to those caused by hallucinogenic drugs. I also experience dissociation, characterized by feeling detached from my surroundings and feeling like I am outside of my own body. These symptoms have been impacting my professional and personal life to a great extent. Additionally, I have been experiencing brain fog, characterized by difficulty concentrating, forgetfulness, confusion, and disorientation.

I also shared with you that I have a history of substance abuse, in particular, the use of Alcohol, LSD, MDMA, and benzodiazepines. I had an overdose on a combination of Xanax and Alcohol. Furthermore, I have been prescribed SSRI's, Sertraline and experienced an adverse reaction.

We discussed the importance of working with a specialist to further evaluate my symptoms, provide a proper diagnosis, and create a treatment plan that is appropriate for me. I understand that recovery is a process and it may take time to improve my symptoms and overall well-being.

I would like to request an appointment with a specialist such as a psychiatrist or a psychologist who is familiar with HPPD, dissociation, and brain fog. Also, I would like to know if there are any other options that can be considered to address my symptoms.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to hearing from you
